Class ValidationUtils

java.lang.Object
dev.bjdelacruz.hexeditor.utils.ValidationUtils
public final class ValidationUtils extends Object
This utility class contains methods for validating data such as row indexes, column indexes, and byte values.

  • Method Summary

    validateNewValue(String newValue)
    Validates that the given value is not less than zero and not greater than 255.

    Validates that the given row index is not less than zero and not greater than the last index in a LazyHexList.

  • Method Details

    • validateRowNumber

      public static Optional<String> validateRowNumber(String row, int lastRowIndex)
      Validates that the given row index is not less than zero and not greater than the last index in a LazyHexList.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index to validate.
      lastRowIndex - The index of the last element in a LazyHexList.
      Returns:
      An empty Optional if the row index is valid, or an Optional that contains a descriptive error message.

    • validateRowAndColumnNumbers

      public static Optional<String> validateRowAndColumnNumbers(String rowText, String columnText, int lastRowIndex, int lastColumnIndex)
      Validates that all the following conditions are met:
      • 0 <= lastRowIndex
      • 0 <= lastColumnIndex
      • 0 <= rowText <= lastRowIndex
      • 0 <= columnText < AppConstants.CHUNK_SIZE
      In addition, if rowText is equal to lastRowIndex, columnText must not be greater than lastColumnIndex.
      Parameters:
      rowText - The row index to validate.
      columnText - The column index to validate.
      lastRowIndex - The index of the last row in the file.
      lastColumnIndex - The index of the last column in the last row of the file, may be less than or equal to AppConstants.CHUNK_SIZE - 1.
      Returns:
      An empty Optional if both the row and column indexes are valid, or an Optional that contains a descriptive error message if at least one of the conditions is not satisfied.

    • validateNewValue

      public static Optional<String> validateNewValue(String newValue)
      Validates that the given value is not less than zero and not greater than 255.
      Parameters:
      newValue - The value to validate.
      Returns:
      An empty Optional if the value is valid, or an Optional that contains a descriptive error message.
